comments.body: Lets see.whois privacy = possible scamno contact info = scamno tos = scamno discussion or announcement about it anywhere = scamLink posted by a ban evading scammer = scamSo yes it's a scam.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: Stvru on September 03, 2023, 09:36:13 PMBit-usd.co legit or scam  Judging solely from the look and content of the website, it strongly suggests that it could be a scam. apart from the Login and Registration forms, there's no additional information about the company. It's definitely a red flag.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.created_time: September 03, 2023, 10:01:29 PMLast edit: September 03, 2023, 10:12:46 PM by Potato Chips
comments.body: How did you find this? Did someone slide on your DM's? because from what I've seen, it's typically how people find these obscure AF websites which turns out to be a scam everytime.Judging how there's absolutely nothing about them, I'd be very surprised if they actually turned out to be legit lol. I say, skip this and anything similar, it is very likely a scam.EDIT: Just saw the edit from the 2nd post. This could just be another scam attempt from OPQuote from: Stvru on September 03, 2023, 09:05:09 PMPlz help i cant sent any amount btc to my btc address , its blocked or blacklisted plz help me Btc address : 19fCVjYVuppjhSvZc4fYimLSjTv63SyoYDSee the many attempts to get money off of people: https://ninjastic.space/address/19fCVjYVuppjhSvZc4fYimLSjTv63SyoYD

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: According to this site: https://webparanoid.com/en/check-website/bit-usd.co Bit-usd.co is a dangerous site.Â  Since according to the site, Bit-usd.co has no social network aside from the fact that it was created in less than a year.Their html analysis stated that:QuoteWe previously found dangerous websites with the same favicon!We previously found dangerous websites with the same page design!We previously found dangerous websites with the same page's title!Aside from that the landing page looks bare and there is no information about the site.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: Quote from: Potato Chips on September 03, 2023, 10:01:29 PMHow did you find this? Did someone slide on your DM's? because from what I've seen, it's typically how people find these obscure AF websites which turns out to be a scam everytime.Judging how there's absolutely nothing about them, I'd be very surprised if they actually turned out to be legit lol. I say, skip this and anything similar, it is very likely a scam.The OP is a banned scammer.From here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5465554They are asking about a certain BTC address. If you look at link @stompix posted you can see that there are a bunch of banned users who use it.https://ninjastic.space/address/19fCVjYVuppjhSvZc4fYimLSjTv63SyoYDSo it's probably just the same scammer.-Dave

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Meaning this is self-promotion trying to make a new account to promote his own phishing/scam site. His alt account is btcpepa04 with some negative feedback that this user keeps asking for a non-collateral loan and promoting a Ponzi scheme.So the website above is also owned by btcpepa04 which is a scammer.Be careful don't try to access the website he might be able to collect your IP and perform a brute-force attack on your device or PC. Please avoid.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Great! At least now we know that this domain is connected to scammer and ban evader, btcpepa04! I am posting this for future reference:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;u=1226722Code:Domain: bit-usd.coNice try, OP!

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: Quote from: Stvru on September 03, 2023, 09:36:13 PMBit-usd.co legit or scam  Guys, stop trying to review for this guy. I tried to check for the requested site and even wanted to use my scam advising site to scrutinise it, but only to detect it was a clickbait.An unsecured site (Bit-usd.co) redirected me to https://www.afternic.com/forsale/usd.co?utm_source=TDFS_DASLNC&utm_medium=DASLNC&utm_campaign=TDFS_DASLNC&traffic_type=TDFS_DASLNC&traffic_id=daslnc&

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: EarnOnVictor on September 05, 2023, 10:22:34 AMGuys, stop trying to review for this guy. I tried to check for the requested site and even wanted to use my scam advising site to scrutinise it, but only to detect it was a clickbait.An unsecured site (Bit-usd.co) redirected me to https:// www.afternic. com /forsale/usd.co?utm_source=TDFS_DASLNC&utm_medium=DASLNC&utm_campaign=TDFS_DASLNC&traffic_type=TDFS_DASLNC&traffic_id=daslnc&I would refrain attaching a direct link of an unknown website especially with those URL parameters. With the overall look of the site it's rushly made and nothing's helpful on such kind of look of a website.
